name: POST_WorkflowsTaskRerun
description: Reruns a specific workflow task by its ID.

Zuora-Entity-Ids.description: An entity ID. If you have [Zuora Multi-entity](https://knowledgecenter.zuora.com/BB_Introducing_Z_Business/Multi-entity) enabled and the OAuth token is valid for more than one entity, you must use this header to specify which entity to perform the operation in. If the OAuth token is only valid for a single entity, or you do not have Zuora Multi-entity enabled, you do not need to set this header.

Zuora-Track-Id.description:
A custom identifier for tracing the API call. If you set a value for this header, Zuora returns the same value in the response headers. This header enables you to associate your system process identifiers with Zuora API calls, to assist with troubleshooting in the event of an issue.

The value of this field must use the US-ASCII character set and must not include any of the following characters: colon (`:`), semicolon (`;`), double quote (`"`), and quote (`'`).

task_id.description: The unique ID of the task.

$ul: **action_type**: The type of the task.
**call_type**: The type of API used.
**concurrent_limit**: the number of concurrent tasks that are allowed to run simultaneously
**data**: The data payload for the task.
**end_time**: If **Instance** is **true**, the end time of the task instance.
**error**: If **Instance** is **true** and **status** is **Error**, the error reason of the task instance failure.
**error_class**: If **Instance** is **true** and **status** is **Error**, the error class of the task instance failure.
**error_details**: If **Instance** is **true** and **status** is **Error**, the error details of the task instance failure.
**id**: The unique ID of the task.
**instance**: Indicates whether this task belongs to an instance of a workflow.
**name**: The name of the task.
**object**: The selected object for the task.
**object_id**: The id of the selected object of the task.
**original_task_id**: If **Instance** is **true**, the ID of the original task in the original workflow.
**original_workflow_id**: If **Instance** is **true**, the ID of the original workflow.
**parameters**: The configuration of the task.
**start_time**: If **Instance** is **true**, the start time of the task instance.
**status**: If **Instance** is **true**, the status of the task instance.
**tags**: The array of filter tags.
**task_id**: the id of this task's parent task. Will be null if this is the first task of the workflow
**workflow_id**: The ID of the workflow that the task belongs to.
